Header: Nigerian police free 259 people held at Islamic institution
Content: Nigerian police have freed 259 people being held at an Islamic rehabilitation centre in the southwestern city of Ibadan, some complained of being beaten regularly by their captors. Images taken shortly after the captives were released showed a group of mostly young men and teenage boys. An infant was also among the group. Many were emaciated. “We eat one meal a day,” one of the men told. Many captives have said they were physically and sexually abused and chained up to prevent them escaping. It was the latest in a series of raids on Islamic institutions in Nigeria in recent weeks. More than 1,000 people, many of them children, have been rescued in total.
